       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

          <input type="text" name="newHotlistName">
        </div>

      </form>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }

          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;

            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

            min-height: 0;

          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }

  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */

    line-height: 1.6;

    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;

    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }

                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>

      <form>
        
      <div class="select-container">
        <i class="material-icons" role="presentation">arrow_drop_down</i>
        <select id="can" name="can" aria-label="Search scope">
          <optgroup label="Search within">
            <option value="1" selected="">All issues</option>
            <option value="2">Open issues</option>
            <option value="3">Open and owned by me</option>
            <option value="4">Open and reported by me</option>
            <option value="5">Open and starred by me</option>
            <option value="8">Open with comment by me</option>
            <option value="6">New issues</option>
            <option value="7">Issues to verify</option>
          </optgroup>
          <optgroup label="Project queries" hidden="">

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_session.cc<span class="line"><!---->ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_session.cc<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void CaptureModeSession::Initialize() {<span class="line"><!---->void CaptureModeSession::Initialize() {<!----></span><br>  // Trigger this before creating `capture_mode_bar_widget_` as we want to read<span class="line"><!---->  // Trigger this before creating `capture_mode_bar_widget_` as we want to read<!----></span><br>  // out this message before reading out the first view of<span class="line"><!---->  // out this message before reading out the first view of<!----></span><br>  // `capture_mode_bar_widget_`.<span class="line"><!---->  // `capture_mode_bar_widget_`.<!----></span><br>  capture_mode_util::TriggerAccessibilityAlert(l10n_util::GetStringFUTF8(<span class="line"><!---->  capture_mode_util::TriggerAccessibilityAlert(l10n_util::GetStringFUTF8(<!----></span><br>      IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_ALERT_OPEN,<span class="line"><!---->      IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_ALERT_OPEN,<!----></span><br>      l10n_util::GetStringUTF16(<span class="line"><!---->      l10n_util::GetStringUTF16(<!----></span><br>          GetMessageIdForInitialCaptureSource(controller_->source())),<span class="line"><!---->          GetMessageIdForInitialCaptureSource(controller_-&gt;source())),<!----></span><br>      l10n_util::GetStringUTF16(<span class="line"><!---->      l10n_util::GetStringUTF16(<!----></span><br>          controller_->type() == CaptureModeType::kImage<span class="line"><!---->          controller_-&gt;type() == CaptureModeType::kImage<!----></span><br>              ? IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_TYPE_SCREENSHOT<span class="line"><!---->              ? IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_TYPE_SCREENSHOT<!----></span><br>              : IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_TYPE_SCREEN_RECORDING)));<span class="line"><!---->              : IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_TYPE_SCREEN_RECORDING)));<!----></span><br><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br><br>  MaybeCreateUserNudge();<span class="line"><!---->  MaybeCreateUserNudge();<!----></span><br><br>  if (is_in_projector_mode_)<span class="line"><!---->  if (is_in_projector_mode_)<!----></span><br>    controller_->camera_controller()->MaybeSelectFirstCamera();<span class="line"><!---->    controller_-&gt;camera_controller()-&gt;MaybeSelectFirstCamera();<!----></span><br><br>  Shell::Get()->AddShellObserver(this); --- [1]<span class="line"><!---->  Shell::Get()-&gt;AddShellObserver(this); --- [1]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>`CaptureModeSession` added as a observer in [1].<span class="line"><!---->`CaptureModeSession` added as a observer in [1].<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void CaptureModeSession::Shutdown() {<span class="line"><!---->void CaptureModeSession::Shutdown() {<!----></span><br>  is_shutting_down_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->  is_shutting_down_ = true;<!----></span><br><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  Shell::Get()->RemoveShellObserver(this); --- [2]<span class="line"><!---->  Shell::Get()-&gt;RemoveShellObserver(this); --- [2]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>And the observer is removed by `CaptureModeSession::Shutdown`.[2]<span class="line"><!---->And the observer is removed by `CaptureModeSession::Shutdown`.[2]<!----></span><br>BUT if `CaptureModeSession` can be removed without calling `CaptureModeSession::Shutdown()`, it will lead to UAF.<span class="line"><!---->BUT if `CaptureModeSession` can be removed without calling `CaptureModeSession::Shutdown()`, it will lead to UAF.<!----></span><br><br>ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_controller.cc<span class="line"><!---->ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_controller.cc<!----></span><br>```<span `CaptureModeController`.<span class="line"><!---->`CaptureModeSession` depends on `CaptureModeController`.<!----></span><br>So, when `CaptureModeController` is removed, `CaptureModeSession` is also removed.<span class="line"><!---->So, when `CaptureModeController` is removed, `CaptureModeSession` is also removed.<!----></span><br><br>ash/shell.cc<span before ~MruWindowTracker.<!----></span><br>  window_cycle_controller_.reset();<span class="line"><!---->  window_cycle_controller_.reset();<!----></span><br>  overview_controller_.reset();<span (including the shelf) and destroy all window containers.<!----></span><br>  CloseAllRootWindowChildWindows();<span class="line"><!---->  CloseAllRootWindowChildWindows();<!----></span><br><br>  multitask_menu_nudge_controller_.reset();<span class="line"><!---->  multitask_menu_nudge_controller_.reset();<!----></span><br>  capture_mode_controller_.reset(); --- [4]<span class="line"><!---->  capture_mode_controller_.reset(); --- [4]<!----></span><br><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span observer.OnShellDestroyed(); --- [5]<span class="line"><!---->    observer.OnShellDestroyed(); --- [5]<!----></span><br><br>  DCHECK(instance_ == this);<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(instance_ == this);<!----></span><br>  instance_ = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->  instance_ = nullptr;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>In `Shell::~Shell`, `CaptureModeController` is deleted. [4] (And `CaptureModeSession` is also removed)<span class="line"><!---->In `Shell::~Shell`, `CaptureModeController` is deleted. [4] (And `CaptureModeSession` is also removed)<!----></span><br>But still `CaptureModeSession` can be accessed at [5]. So it cause a UAF.<span class="line"><!---->But still `CaptureModeSession` can be accessed at [5]. So it cause a UAF.<!----></span><br><br><br>* Patch Suggestion<span class="line"><!---->* Patch Suggestion<!----></span><br><br>ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_session.cc<span class="line"><!---->ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_session.cc<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>CaptureModeSession::~CaptureModeSession() {<span class="line"><!---->CaptureModeSession::~CaptureModeSession() {<!----></span><br>  Shell::Get()->RemoveShellObserver(this);<span class="line"><!---->  Shell::Get()-&gt;RemoveShellObserver(this);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Remove the observer in its destructor.<span class="line"><!---->Remove the observer in its destructor.<!----></span><br><br>* Opinion<span class="line"><!---->* Opinion<!----></span><br><br>I think there are similar patterns exist in other places.<span class="line"><!---->I think there are similar patterns exist in other places.<!----></span><br>They are potentially vulnerable.<span class="line"><!---->They are potentially vulnerable.<!----></span><br><br>1. <span class="line"><!---->1. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/wm/overview/overview_session.cc;l=294<a class="undefined"           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1350738#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_session.cc<span class="line"><!---->ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_session.cc<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void CaptureModeSession::Initialize() {<span class="line"><!---->void CaptureModeSession::Initialize() {<!----></span><br>  // Trigger this before creating `capture_mode_bar_widget_` as we want to read<span class="line"><!---->  // Trigger this before creating `capture_mode_bar_widget_` as we want to read<!----></span><br>  // out this message before reading out the first view of<span class="line"><!---->  // out this message before reading out the first view of<!----></span><br>  // `capture_mode_bar_widget_`.<span class="line"><!---->  // `capture_mode_bar_widget_`.<!----></span><br>  capture_mode_util::TriggerAccessibilityAlert(l10n_util::GetStringFUTF8(<span class="line"><!---->  capture_mode_util::TriggerAccessibilityAlert(l10n_util::GetStringFUTF8(<!----></span><br>      IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_ALERT_OPEN,<span class="line"><!---->      IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_ALERT_OPEN,<!----></span><br>      l10n_util::GetStringUTF16(<span class="line"><!---->      l10n_util::GetStringUTF16(<!----></span><br>          GetMessageIdForInitialCaptureSource(controller_->source())),<span class="line"><!---->          GetMessageIdForInitialCaptureSource(controller_-&gt;source())),<!----></span><br>      l10n_util::GetStringUTF16(<span class="line"><!---->      l10n_util::GetStringUTF16(<!----></span><br>          controller_->type() == CaptureModeType::kImage<span class="line"><!---->          controller_-&gt;type() == CaptureModeType::kImage<!----></span><br>              ? IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_TYPE_SCREENSHOT<span class="line"><!---->              ? IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_TYPE_SCREENSHOT<!----></span><br>              : IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_TYPE_SCREEN_RECORDING)));<span class="line"><!---->              : IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_TYPE_SCREEN_RECORDING)));<!----></span><br><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br><br>  MaybeCreateUserNudge();<span class="line"><!---->  MaybeCreateUserNudge();<!----></span><br><br>  if (is_in_projector_mode_)<span class="line"><!---->  if (is_in_projector_mode_)<!----></span><br>    controller_->camera_controller()->MaybeSelectFirstCamera();<span class="line"><!---->    controller_-&gt;camera_controller()-&gt;MaybeSelectFirstCamera();<!----></span><br><br>  Shell::Get()->AddShellObserver(this); --- [1]<span class="line"><!---->  Shell::Get()-&gt;AddShellObserver(this); --- [1]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>`CaptureModeSession` added as a observer in [1].<span class="line"><!---->`CaptureModeSession` added as a observer in [1].<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void CaptureModeSession::Shutdown() {<span class="line"><!---->void CaptureModeSession::Shutdown() {<!----></span><br>  is_shutting_down_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->  is_shutting_down_ = true;<!----></span><br><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  Shell::Get()->RemoveShellObserver(this); --- [2]<span class="line"><!---->  Shell::Get()-&gt;RemoveShellObserver(this); --- [2]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>And the observer is removed by `CaptureModeSession::Shutdown`.[2]<span class="line"><!---->And the observer is removed by `CaptureModeSession::Shutdown`.[2]<!----></span><br>BUT if `CaptureModeSession` can be removed without calling `CaptureModeSession::Shutdown()`, it will lead to UAF.<span class="line"><!---->BUT if `CaptureModeSession` can be removed without calling `CaptureModeSession::Shutdown()`, it will lead to UAF.<!----></span><br><br>ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_controller.cc<span class="line"><!---->ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_controller.cc<!----></span><br>```<span delegate_->OnSessionStateChanged(/*started=*/true);<span class="line"><!---->  delegate_-&gt;OnSessionStateChanged(/*started=*/true);<!----></span><br><br>  capture_mode_session_ =<span class="line"><!---->  capture_mode_session_ =<!----></span><br>      std::make_unique<CaptureModeSession>(this, for_projector); --- [3]<span class="line"><!---->      std::make_unique&lt;CaptureModeSession&gt;(this, for_projector); --- [3]<!----></span><br>  capture_mode_session_->Initialize();<span class="line"><!---->  capture_mode_session_-&gt;Initialize();<!----></span><br><br>  camera_controller_->OnCaptureSessionStarted();<span class="line"><!---->  camera_controller_-&gt;OnCaptureSessionStarted();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>`CaptureModeSession` depends on `CaptureModeController`.<span class="line"><!---->`CaptureModeSession` depends on `CaptureModeController`.<!----></span><br>So, when `CaptureModeController` is removed, `CaptureModeSession` is also removed.<span class="line"><!---->So, when `CaptureModeController` is removed, `CaptureModeSession` is also removed.<!----></span><br><br>ash/shell.cc<span class="line"><!---->ash/shell.cc<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Shell::~Shell() {<span class="line"><!---->Shell::~Shell() {<!----></span><br> is<!----></span><br>  // destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->  // destroyed.<!----></span><br>  for (RootWindowController* rwc : GetAllRootWindowControllers())<span class="line"><!---->  for (RootWindowController* rwc : GetAllRootWindowControllers())<!----></span><br>    DCHECK(rwc->GetHost()->dispatcher()->in_shutdown());<span class="line"><!---->    DCHECK(rwc-&gt;GetHost()-&gt;dispatcher()-&gt;in_shutdown());<!----></span><br>#endif<span class="line"><!---->#endif<!----></span><br><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br><br>  // Has to happen before ~MruWindowTracker.<span class="line"><!---->  // Has to happen before ~MruWindowTracker.<!----></span><br>  window_cycle_controller_.reset();<span class="line"><!---->  window_cycle_controller_.reset();<!----></span><br>  overview_controller_.reset();<span class="line"><!---->  overview_controller_.reset();<!----></span><br><br>  // Close all widgets (including the shelf) and destroy all window containers.<span class="line"><!---->  // Close all widgets             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">

            <div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_session.cc<span class="line"><!---->ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_session.cc<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void CaptureModeSession::Initialize() {<span class="line"><!---->void CaptureModeSession::Initialize() {<!----></span><br>  // Trigger this before creating `capture_mode_bar_widget_` as we want to read<span class="line"><!---->  // Trigger this before creating `capture_mode_bar_widget_` as we want to read<!----></span><br>  // out this message before reading out the first view of<span class="line"><!---->  // out this message before reading out the first view of<!----></span><br>  // `capture_mode_bar_widget_`.<span class="line"><!---->  // `capture_mode_bar_widget_`.<!----></span><br>  capture_mode_util::TriggerAccessibilityAlert(l10n_util::GetStringFUTF8(<span class="line"><!---->  capture_mode_util::TriggerAccessibilityAlert(l10n_util::GetStringFUTF8(<!----></span><br>      IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_ALERT_OPEN,<span class="line"><!---->      IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_ALERT_OPEN,<!----></span><br>      l10n_util::GetStringUTF16(<span class="line"><!---->      l10n_util::GetStringUTF16(<!----></span><br>          GetMessageIdForInitialCaptureSource(controller_->source())),<span class="line"><!---->          GetMessageIdForInitialCaptureSource(controller_-&gt;source())),<!----></span><br>      l10n_util::GetStringUTF16(<span class="line"><!---->      l10n_util::GetStringUTF16(<!----></span><br>          controller_->type() == CaptureModeType::kImage<span class="line"><!---->          controller_-&gt;type() == CaptureModeType::kImage<!----></span><br>              ? IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_TYPE_SCREENSHOT<span class="line"><!---->              ? IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_TYPE_SCREENSHOT<!----></span><br>              : IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_TYPE_SCREEN_RECORDING)));<span class="line"><!---->              : IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_TYPE_SCREEN_RECORDING)));<!----></span><br><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br><br>  MaybeCreateUserNudge();<span class="line"><!---->  MaybeCreateUserNudge();<!----></span><br><br>  if (is_in_projector_mode_)<span class="line"><!---->  if (is_in_projector_mode_)<!----></span><br>    controller_->camera_controller()->MaybeSelectFirstCamera();<span class="line"><!---->    controller_-&gt;camera_controller()-&gt;MaybeSelectFirstCamera();<!----></span><br><br>  Shell::Get()->AddShellObserver(this); --- [1]<span class="line"><!---->  Shell::Get()-&gt;AddShellObserver(this); --- [1]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>`CaptureModeSession` added as a observer in [1].<span class="line"><!---->`CaptureModeSession` added as a observer in [1].<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void CaptureModeSession::Shutdown() {<span class="line"><!---->void CaptureModeSession::Shutdown() {<!----></span><br>  is_shutting_down_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->  is_shutting_down_ = true;<!----></span><br><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  Shell::Get()->RemoveShellObserver(this); --- [2]<span class="line"><!---->  Shell::Get()-&gt;RemoveShellObserver(this); --- [2]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>And the observer is removed by `CaptureModeSession::Shutdown`.[2]<span class="line"><!---->And the observer is removed by `CaptureModeSession::Shutdown`.[2]<!----></span><br>BUT if `CaptureModeSession` can be removed without calling `CaptureModeSession::Shutdown()`, it will lead to UAF.<span class="line"><!---->BUT if `CaptureModeSession` can be removed without calling `CaptureModeSession::Shutdown()`, it will lead to UAF.<!----></span><br><br>ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_controller.cc<span class="line"><!---->ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_controller.cc<!----></span><br>```<span delegate_->OnSessionStateChanged(/*started=*/true);<span class="line"><!---->  delegate_-&gt;OnSessionStateChanged(/*started=*/true);<!----></span><br><br>  capture_mode_session_ =<span class="line"><!---->  capture_mode_session_ =<!----></span><br>      std::make_unique<CaptureModeSession>(this, for_projector); --- [3]<span class="line"><!---->      std::make_unique&lt;CaptureModeSession&gt;(this, for_projector); --- [3]<!----></span><br>  capture_mode_session_->Initialize();<span class="line"><!---->  capture_mode_session_-&gt;Initialize();<!----></span><br><br>  camera_controller_->OnCaptureSessionStarted();<span class="line"><!---->  camera_controller_-&gt;OnCaptureSessionStarted();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>`CaptureModeSession` depends on `CaptureModeController`.<span class="line"><!---->`CaptureModeSession` depends on `CaptureModeController`.<!----></span><br>So, when `CaptureModeController` is removed, `CaptureModeSession` is also removed.<span class="line"><!---->So, when `CaptureModeController` is removed, `CaptureModeSession` is also removed.<!----></span><br><br>ash/shell.cc<span class="line"><!---->ash/shell.cc<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Shell::~Shell() {<span class="line"><!---->Shell::~Shell() {<!----></span><br> is<!----></span><br>  // destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->  // destroyed.<!----></span><br>  for (RootWindowController* rwc : GetAllRootWindowControllers())<span class="line"><!---->  for (RootWindowController* rwc : GetAllRootWindowControllers())<!----></span><br>    DCHECK(rwc->GetHost()->dispatcher()->in_shutdown());<span class="line"><!---->    DCHECK(rwc-&gt;GetHost()-&gt;dispatcher()-&gt;in_shutdown());<!----></span><br>#endif<span class="line"><!---->#endif<!----></span><br><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br><br>  // Has to happen before ~MruWindowTracker.<span class="line"><!---->  // Has to happen before ~MruWindowTracker.<!----></span><br>  window_cycle_controller_.reset();<span class="line"><!---->  window_cycle_controller_.reset();<!----></span><br>  overview_controller_.reset();<span class="line"><!---->  overview_controller_.reset();<!----></span><br><br>  // Close all widgets (including the shelf) and destroy all window containers.<span class="line"><!---->  // Close all widgets (including the shelf) and destroy all window containers.<!----></span><br>  CloseAllRootWindowChildWindows();<span class="line"><!---->  CloseAllRootWindowChildWindows();<!----></span><br><br>  multitask_menu_nudge_controller_.reset();<span class="line"><!---->  multitask_menu_nudge_controller_.reset();<!----></span><br>  capture_mode_controller_.reset(); --- [4]<span class="line"><!---->  capture_mode_controller_.reset(); --- [4]<!----></span><br><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br><br>  for (auto& observer : shell_observers_)<span class="line"><!---->  for (auto&amp; observer : shell_observers_)<!----></span><br>    observer.OnShellDestroyed(); --- [5]<span class="line"><!---->    observer.OnShellDestroyed(); --- [5]<!----></span><br><br>  DCHECK(instance_ == this);<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(instance_ == this);<!----></span><br>  instance_ = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->  instance_ = nullptr;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>In `Shell::~Shell`, `CaptureModeController` is deleted. [4] (And `CaptureModeSession` is also removed)<span class="line"><!---->In `Shell::~Shell`, `CaptureModeController` is deleted. [4] (And `CaptureModeSession` is also removed)<!----></span><br>But still `CaptureModeSession` can be accessed at [5]. So it cause a UAF.<span class="line"><!---->But still `CaptureModeSession` can be accessed at [5]. So it cause a UAF.<!----></span><br><br><br>* Patch Suggestion<span class="line"><!---->* Patch Suggestion<!----></span><br><br>ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_session.cc<span class="line"><!---->ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_session.cc<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>CaptureModeSession::~CaptureModeSession() {<span class="line"><!---->CaptureModeSession::~CaptureModeSession() {<!----></span><br>  Shell::Get()->RemoveShellObserver(this);<span class="line"><!---->  Shell::Get()-&gt;RemoveShellObserver(this);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Remove the observer in its destructor.<span class="line"><!---->Remove the observer in its destructor.<!----></span><br><br>* Opinion<span class="line"><!---->* Opinion<!----></span><br><br>I think there are similar patterns exist in other       VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_session.cc<span class="line"><!---->ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_session.cc<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void CaptureModeSession::Initialize() {<span class="line"><!---->void CaptureModeSession::Initialize() {<!----></span><br>  // Trigger this before creating `capture_mode_bar_widget_` as we want to read<span class="line"><!---->  // Trigger this before creating `capture_mode_bar_widget_` as we want to read<!----></span><br>  // out this message before reading out the first view of<span class="line"><!---->  // out this message before reading out the first view of<!----></span><br>  // `capture_mode_bar_widget_`.<span class="line"><!---->  // `capture_mode_bar_widget_`.<!----></span><br>  capture_mode_util::TriggerAccessibilityAlert(l10n_util::GetStringFUTF8(<span class="line"><!---->  capture_mode_util::TriggerAccessibilityAlert(l10n_util::GetStringFUTF8(<!----></span><br>      IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_ALERT_OPEN,<span class="line"><!---->      IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_ALERT_OPEN,<!----></span><br>      l10n_util::GetStringUTF16(<span class="line"><!---->      l10n_util::GetStringUTF16(<!----></span><br>          GetMessageIdForInitialCaptureSource(controller_->source())),<span class="line"><!---->          GetMessageIdForInitialCaptureSource(controller_-&gt;source())),<!----></span><br>      l10n_util::GetStringUTF16(<span class="line"><!---->      l10n_util::GetStringUTF16(<!----></span><br>          controller_->type() == CaptureModeType::kImage<span class="line"><!---->          controller_-&gt;type() == CaptureModeType::kImage<!----></span><br>              ? IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_TYPE_SCREENSHOT<span class="line"><!---->              ? IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_TYPE_SCREENSHOT<!----></span><br>              : IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_TYPE_SCREEN_RECORDING)));<span class="line"><!---->              : IDS_ASH_SCREEN_CAPTURE_TYPE_SCREEN_RECORDING)));<!----></span><br><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br><br>  MaybeCreateUserNudge();<span class="line"><!---->  MaybeCreateUserNudge();<!----></span><br><br>  if (is_in_projector_mode_)<span class="line"><!---->  if (is_in_projector_mode_)<!----></span><br>    controller_->camera_controller()->MaybeSelectFirstCamera();<span class="line"><!---->    controller_-&gt;camera_controller()-&gt;MaybeSelectFirstCamera();<!----></span><br><br>  Shell::Get()->AddShellObserver(this); --- [1]<span class="line"><!---->  Shell::Get()-&gt;AddShellObserver(this); --- [1]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>`CaptureModeSession` added as a observer in [1].<span class="line"><!---->`CaptureModeSession` added as a observer in [1].<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void CaptureModeSession::Shutdown() {<span class="line"><!---->void CaptureModeSession::Shutdown() {<!----></span><br>  is_shutting_down_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->  is_shutting_down_ = true;<!----></span><br><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  Shell::Get()->RemoveShellObserver(this); --- [2]<span class="line"><!---->  Shell::Get()-&gt;RemoveShellObserver(this); --- [2]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>And the observer is removed by `CaptureModeSession::Shutdown`.[2]<span class="line"><!---->And the observer is removed by `CaptureModeSession::Shutdown`.[2]<!----></span><br>BUT if `CaptureModeSession` can be removed without calling `CaptureModeSession::Shutdown()`, it will lead to UAF.<span class="line"><!---->BUT if `CaptureModeSession` can be removed without calling `CaptureModeSession::Shutdown()`, it will lead to UAF.<!----></span><br><br>ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_controller.cc<span class="line"><!---->ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_controller.cc<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void CaptureModeController::OnDlpRestrictionCheckedAtSessionInit(<span class="line"><!---->void         Ah it seems that OnChromeTerminating() was called before the a new session started. I have a fix for <span class="line"><!---->also reported by you, but not this one. fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd<span class="line"><!---->  0x0c32800a6970: fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd<!----></span><br>  0x0c32800a6980: fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd<span class="line"><!---->  0x0c32800a6980: fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd<!----></span><br>  0x0c32800a6990: fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd<span class="line"><!---->  0x0c32800a6990: fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd<!----></span><br>  0x0c32800a69a0: fd fd fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa<span class="line"><!---->  0x0c32800a69a0: fd fd fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa<!----></span><br>Shadow byte legend (one shadow byte represents 8 application bytes):<span class="line"><!---->Shadow byte legend (one shadow byte represents 8 application bytes):<!----></span><br>  Addressable:           00<span class="line"><!---->  Addressable:           00<!----></span><br>  Partially addressable: 01 02 03 04 05 06 07 <span class="line"><!---->  Partially addressable: 01 02 03 04 05 06 07 <!----></span><br>  Heap left redzone:       fa<span class="line"><!---->  Heap left redzone:       fa<!----></span><br>  Freed heap region:       fd<span class="line"><!---->  Freed heap region:       fd<!----></span><br>  Stack left redzone:      f1<span class="line"><!---->  Stack left redzone:      f1<!----></span><br>  Stack mid redzone:       f2<span class="line"><!---->  Stack mid redzone:       f2<!----></span><br>  Stack right redzone:     f3<span class="line"><!---->  Stack right redzone:     f3<!----></span><br>  Stack after return:      f5<span class="line"><!---->  Stack after return:      f5<!----></span><br>  Stack use after scope:   f8<span class="line"><!---->  Stack use after scope:   f8<!----></span><br>  Global redzone:          f9<span class="line"><!---->  Global redzone:          f9<!----></span><br>  Global init order:       f6<span class="line"><!---->  Global init order:       f6<!----></span><br>  Poisoned by user:        f7<span class="line"><!---->  Poisoned by user:        f7<!----></span><br>  Container overflow:      fc<span class="line"><!---->  Container overflow:      fc<!----></span><br>  Array cookie:            ac<span class="line"><!---->  Array cookie:            ac<!----></span><br>  Intra object redzone:    bb<span class="line"><!---->  Intra object redzone:    bb<!----></span><br>  ASan internal:           fe<span class="line"><!---->  ASan internal:           fe<!----></span><br>  Left alloca redzone:     ca<span class="line"><!---->  Left alloca redzone:     ca<!----></span><br>  Right alloca redzone:    cb<span class="line"><!---->  Right alloca redzone:    cb<!----></span><br>==2248944==ABORTING<span class="line"><!---->==2248944==ABORTING<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit:         CaptureModeController::OnChromeTerminating() should be called when shutting down, and it should take care of shutting down any running session: <span class="line"><!---->CaptureModeController::OnChromeTerminating() should be called when shutting down, and it should take care of shutting down any running session: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_controller.cc;drc=05714e1af5713af8f0856d5637068f52254b8b7b;l=782<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_controller.cc;drc=05714e1af5713af8f0856d5637068f52254b8b7b;l=782"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_controller.cc;drc=05714e1af5713af8f0856d5637068f52254b8b7b;l=782<!----></a><br><br>I'm not sure why it's not getting called in your case. Looking...<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure why it's not getting called in your case. Looking...<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

{<span class="line"><!---->void CaptureModeSession::Shutdown() {<!----></span><br>  is_shutting_down_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->  is_shutting_down_ = true;<!----></span><br><br>  ...<span is removed by `CaptureModeSession::Shutdown`.[2]<!----></span><br>BUT if `CaptureModeSession` can be removed without calling `CaptureModeSession::Shutdown()`, it will lead to UAF.<span UAF.<!----></span><br><br>ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_controller.cc<span class="line"><!---->ash/capture_mode/capture_mode_controller.cc<!----></span><br>```<span `CaptureModeController`.<span class="line"><!---->`CaptureModeSession` depends on `CaptureModeController`.<!----></span><br>So, when `CaptureModeController` is removed, `CaptureModeSession` is also removed.<span class="line"><!---->So, when `CaptureModeController` is removed, `CaptureModeSession` is also removed.<!----></span><br><br>ash/shell.cc<span            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

// Load and instantiate pRPC client before any other script.
window.prpcClient = new AutoRefreshPrpcClient(
 CS_env.token, CS_env.tokenExpiresSec);

 CS_env.token, CS_env.tokenExpiresSec);

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
